personas.content: I'm having trouble with the loop for counting even numbers in the assignment. Can you help?
Sure! Are you able to identify where your loop should start and end to process user input until they type "End"?
I think it starts with a while loop, but I'm not sure how to correctly check for "End" within it.
You want to use a loop that continues as long as the user input isn't "End". Try using a condition in the while loop to check for that.
Okay, I will give it a try. Thanks!
How do I calculate the average of the even numbers only?
First, count the even numbers and sum them up. Then divide the sum by the number of even numbers, excluding zeros.
I understand the sum part, but how do I exclude zeros from the count?
Try using an if statement inside your loop to check if a number is not zero before you add it to your count.
Got it! That makes sense.
I keep getting a syntax error when defining my function for the ISBN conversion. Any tips?
Check your function definition. Make sure the syntax includes 'def' followed by the function name, parentheses, and a colon at the end.
Oh, I see! I missed the colon. I always forget that part.
No worries, it's a common mistake. Now with the colon, it should work!
When counting vowels and consonants, should I differentiate between lowercase and uppercase letters?
That's a good question! It might be easier if you convert the input to all lowercase before checking so your loop doesn't have to check both cases.
Good idea! I'll do that.
I'm still a bit lost on documenting errors. How should I start?
Start by noting the line number and type of error. Then, describe how you fixed it. This reflection helps deepen your understanding.
Okay, I'll document a few examples to practice.
